channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-14851] LambdaTestUtils.eventually() doesn't spin on Assertion failures
item.description:
This is funny. The LsmbdaTestUtils.eventually() method, meant to spin until a closure stops raising exceptions, doesn't catch Error and subclasses, so doesn't fail on an Assert.assert() failure, which raises an AssertionError. My bad

Example:

    eventually(TIMEOUT,
        () -> {
          while (counter.incrementAndGet()  < 5) {
            assert false : "oops";
          }
        },
        retryLogic);

Fix: catch Throwable, rethrow. Needs to add VirtualMachineError & subclasses to the set of errors not to spin on (OOM, stack overflow, ...)
item.summary: LambdaTestUtils.eventually() doesn't spin on Assertion failures

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Patch 001

  1. Errors are caught alongside Exception
  2. Except for VM errors: stack overflow, out of memory, etc: the things you can't recover from.
  3. On timeout of eventually/await the caught exception/error is rethrown
  4. to avoid changing the signature of await and eventually (needed to keep them invocable in a Callable<> clause), the Throwable is cast up to Exception/Error before raise
  5. And TimeoutHandler has had its args/return value widened to Throwable. That would be incompatible, but its not in use anywhere in the code.

Tests: lots

-1 overall

Test failure seems impossible to associate with this code, as the test which fails doesn't use the edited code. And it works locally.

java.lang.AssertionError: null
	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:86)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:41)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:52)
	at org.apache.hadoop.metrics2.sink.TestFileSink.testFileSink(TestFileSink.java:135)

checkstyle complaints are about layout of lambda-expressions; wrapping the calls up to keep it lean and readable without checkstyle overreacting
Patch 002; address checkstyle issues. Tested the hadoop-aws module with this patch, as we've been using the operations there in the new tests. All seems well

-1 overall

Committed to trunk after testing. Thanks for your contribution stevel@apache.org

(BTW, I wasn't sure if this should go on branch-2. What is our current guidelines for backporting s3a stuff to branch-2?)

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #12829 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/12829/)
HADOOP-14851 LambdaTestUtils.eventually() doesn't spin on Assertion (fabbri: rev 180e814b081d3707c95641171d649b547db41a04)

  • (edit) hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/test/LambdaTestUtils.java
  • (edit) hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/test/TestLambdaTestUtils.java
Thanks. I would like it into branch-2, but will need to add a couple of tests which aren't real l-expressions, by migrating a couple of the new ones

cherry picked the changes to LambdaTestUtils into branch-2, retested hadoop common and the hadoop-aws code, that being where we use it the most.
I didn't include the test changes as they are all lambda-expressions; I could have redefined them all as callables, but that'd have made for a bigger change between the branches. I'm relying on the logic in trunk to do the tests
I've cherry-picked this to branch-3.0 for beta1.
sorry, had thought I'd done that. thanks
